alert.note: Alert for Chelan (Washington) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Spokane (Eastern Washington and Northern Idaho)
info.headline: Flood Warning issued May 19 at 9:26AM PDT until May 23 at 7:00AM PDT by NWS Spokane
info.description: ...The Flood Warning is extended for the following rivers in Washington... Stehekin River at Stehekin affecting Chelan County. .Warm temperatures will melt high mountain snowpack and result in increased river flows. For the Stehekin River...including Stehekin...Minor flooding is forecast. ...FLOOD WARNING NOW IN EFFECT UNTIL TUESDAY MORNING... * WHAT...Minor flooding is forecast. * WHERE...Stehekin River at Stehekin. * WHEN...Until Tuesday morning. * IMPACTS...At 24.0 feet, The river may be out of its banks in spots on parts of Stehekin Valley Road and Company Creek Road, especially from Harlequin Bridge to about seven miles upstream. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 8:30 AM PDT Friday the stage was 24.0 feet. - Bankfull stage is 22.0 feet. - Forecast...The river will oscillate around flood stage through Tuesday morning with a maximum value of 24.6 feet late tomorrow evening. The Stehekin River will recede next week with the arrival of cooler temperatures. - Flood stage is 24.0 feet. - Flood History...This crest compares to a previous crest of 25.0 feet on 05/30/1995. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Cold and swift flowing rivers can be life threatening this time of year. The combination of cold water shock and fast current increases the danger of drowning in our rivers. Keep an eye on children if they are playing near rivers and put a life jacket on them. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov. The next statement will be issued by the middle of Friday evening.this evening at 930 PM PDT.
